method_notes: Passenger car, gasoline, ~180 gCO2e/km average
Cycling operational emissions ~0

Ontario-weighted mix: 60% TV, 30% laptop, 10% smartphone using playback power ranges in SRC.PIHKOLA.2020; HD bitrate 2.5 GB/h (1.5–4) from SRC.DIMPACT.STREAMING.2022; network intensity 0.018 kWh/GB (0.01–0.03) from SRC.ASLAN.2018; data-centre energy 0.005 kWh/GB (0.003–0.008) assuming PUE 1.2 aligned with SRC.MASANET.2020; combined with 2024 Ontario grid 28 g/kWh (SRC.IESO.2024).

Ontario-weighted mix: 60% TV, 30% laptop, 10% smartphone with playback power ranges from SRC.PIHKOLA.2020; UHD bitrate 7 GB/h (5–11) from SRC.DIMPACT.STREAMING.2022; network intensity 0.018 kWh/GB (0.01–0.03) from SRC.ASLAN.2018; data-centre energy 0.005 kWh/GB (0.003–0.008) assuming PUE 1.2 aligned with SRC.MASANET.2020; Ontario grid factor 28 g/kWh (SRC.IESO.2024).
Median cradle-to-grave intensity for beef from Poore & Nemecek (2018) of 60 kgCO2e/kg applied to a 150 g cooked portion; lower and upper quartiles (36–82 kgCO2e/kg) set bounds.
Median poultry meat intensity of 6 kgCO2e/kg applied to a 150 g cooked portion; quartile range (4–7 kgCO2e/kg) sets bounds.
Median legumes/pulses intensity of 2 kgCO2e/kg applied to a 150 g cooked portion; quartile range (1.2–3.2 kgCO2e/kg) sets bounds.

Hintemann & Hinterholzer social platform intensity (~0.23 kgCO2e/hr) aligned with Ontario grid and cross-checked against SRC.IEA.DIGITALISATION.2021 network/device benchmarks and SRC.GOOGLE.SR.2023 disclosures; bounds reflect SRC.MALMODIN2018 ICT uncertainty.
Hintemann & Hinterholzer Facebook estimate (0.06 kgCO2e/hr) tuned with SRC.META.SR.2023 operational efficiency disclosures and SRC.IEA.DIGITALISATION.2021 network/data-centre intensity ranges.

Instagram hour derived from SRC.HINTEMANN2022 mobile-focused scenario with SRC.META.SR.2023 efficiency improvements and SRC.IEA.DIGITALISATION.2021 bandwidth intensity to set ±40% bounds informed by SRC.MALMODIN2018.

TikTok per-hour footprint (0.15 kgCO2e/hr) from SRC.HINTEMANN2022 short-video profile benchmarked to SRC.IEA.DIGITALISATION.2021 network intensity and Chinese/global datacentre disclosures; spread widened to reflect SRC.MALMODIN2018 variability.
Twitter/X browsing electricity (0.055 kgCO2e/hr) per SRC.HINTEMANN2022, validated against SRC.IEA.DIGITALISATION.2021 network/device ranges and broader ICT intensity bounds from SRC.MALMODIN2018.

Snapchat hour from SRC.HINTEMANN2022 handset-intensive scenario, adjusted with SRC.META.SR.2023 infrastructure efficiency and SRC.IEA.DIGITALISATION.2021 bandwidth ranges; ±40% uncertainty from SRC.MALMODIN2018.
~4 kgCO2e per cotton T-shirt
~33 kgCO2e per jeans
~25 kgCO2e per synthetic jacket
~14 kgCO2e per sneakers
Lifecycle emissions allocated per wear assuming 50 wears per garment
Lifecycle emissions allocated per wear assuming 100 wears per garment
Lifecycle emissions allocated per wear assuming 150 wears per garment
Lifecycle emissions allocated per wear assuming 200 wears per pair
LinkedIn browsing intensity (0.05 kgCO2e/hr) via SRC.HINTEMANN2022 knowledge-worker profile, cross-checked with SRC.MALMODIN2018 ICT footprint ratios and SRC.IEA.DIGITALISATION.2021 network data.
~280 gCO2e per 1k GPT tokens (cloud, mixed datacentre regions)
Claude estimated footprint per 1k tokens
Google inference on carbon-optimized TPUs, per 1k tokens
IESO reported 2024 Ontario grid mix intensity for system electricity.
Ontario grid intensity
Combustion + upstream
WTT+TTW per litre

Derived from CUTA/MTO 2017 modal statistics allocating 85% of system electricity to heavy rail by revenue vehicle-kilometres and applying a 0.170 kWh/passenger-km intensity (0.136–0.222 kWh) with 2024 IESO grid intensity; passenger-kilometre share ±10% and 75–100% electricity allocation retained in bounds.
Converted 2017 TTC diesel consumption using UK 2023 mineral diesel factor and divided by bus passenger-kilometres estimated from boardings; ±10% passenger-kilometre assumption captured in bounds.

Diesel CO2e intensity computed with MOVES3 class-6 single-unit urban fuel economy of 7.4 mpg from SRC.EPA.MOVES.HDV.2021 and EPA GHGI tailpipe factors (10.21 kgCO2/gal plus CH4 and N2O) from SRC.EPA.GHGI.2023; ±10% bounds capture route variability.
ICCT field deployments of medium-duty urban electric trucks reported 2.1 kWh/mi (≈1.3 kWh/km) with ±15% spread across routes; applied to the corporate delivery scenario for comparison.
